entry.title: Quick Guide to Bioinformatics for Horticulture Students
entry.content:
This guide consists of four parts. I will elaborate on them one by one.

1. Introduction and minimal computer skill sets

Assuming that readers have a biology/horticulture background, some computer utilization skills are required to start the journey into bioinfomatics. Just to list a few: familirity with unix-like environment and using command-line, text editor setting, running scripts (maybe R or Python).

RNA-Sick@Day1 > 你己被選中成為「賽博格研究生」｜生物資訊 の 冒險記趣 feat. Phylo

RNA-Sick@Day2 > 一旦接受了這種設定，操作起電腦還是挺帶感的嘛｜像個駭客一樣用電腦 feat. Terminal (終端機)

RNA-Sick@Day3 > 小孩子才要做選擇，我全都要｜入門生物資訊該學什麼語言呢 feat. Anaconda

RNA-Sick@Day4 > 我們凡事求一個圓｜第一次執行 Python 腳本就來算圓周率吧 feat. Jupyter Notebook

RNA-Sick@Day5 > 原來是純文字編輯器啊，我還以為是整合式開發環境呢｜準備一個喜歡的打字所在 feat. Atom

RNA-Sick@Day6 > 我相信自由自在，我詳細希望｜下載 NCBI 上的原始序列 feat. SRA Toolkit (上)

RNA-Sick@Day7 > 我相信自由自在，我詳細希望｜下載 NCBI 上的原始序列 feat. SRA Toolkit (下)

2. Transcriptome pipeline

RNA-Sequencing (RNA-Seq) is one of the major game changing technologies in crop research. It is also the main reason for normal biology/horticulture students to further dive into bioinformatics. Although most of the sequencing service providers nowadays would generate a basic report containing figures and tables that can be directly used for publication, understanding the principles and algorithms is still a must for correct interpretation.

RNA-Sick@Day8 > Raw Data 是什麼，能吃嗎？｜ 一鍵了解序列品質 feat. FastQC

RNA-Sick@Day9 > 斷開序列，斷開一切的牽連｜把品質不佳的序列剔除掉 feat. Trimmomatic

RNA-Sick@Day10 > 我來組成頭部｜把短片段序列組裝成轉錄體 feat. Trinity

RNA-Sick@Day11 > 轉錄體補完計畫｜比對線上資料庫註解序列 feat. Trinotate

RNA-Sick@Day12 > 路遙知馬力，日久見人心｜用燕尾服套裝將序列比對到參考對象上 feat. Bowtie2

RNA-Sick@Day13 > 萬物皆虛，萬事皆允｜不用 alignment 推估表現量 feat. kallisto

RNA-Sick@Day14 > 檢定只是裝飾而已，上面的大人物是不會懂的｜篩選表現量有顯著差異的基因 feat. edgeR

RNA-Sick@Day15 > 銀河在呼喚我｜在網頁介面下完成轉錄體分析流程 feat. Galaxy

3. Comprehensive Analysis

After acquiring differentially expressed genes from RNA-Seq, there are various ways to discover biological meanings from the data. Interesting results can be yielded by using heatmap to visualize transcript abundance, gene clustering according to expression pattern, or accessing online database using custom script.

RNA-Sick@Day16 > 基因代號進得去，生物意義出得來，GO 發大財｜基因本體論富集分析 feat. Gene Ontology (上)

RNA-Sick@Day17 > 基因代號進得去，生物意義出得來，GO 發大財｜基因本體論富集分析 feat. Panther classification system (中)

RNA-Sick@Day18 > 基因代號進得去，生物意義出得來，GO 發大財｜基因本體論富集分析 feat. REViGO (下)

RNA-Sick@Day19 > 快用你那無敵的非監督機器學習想想辦法吧｜依據表現量特徵將基因分群 feat. MAPMAN (上)

RNA-Sick@Day20 > 快用你那無敵的非監督機器學習想想辦法吧｜依據表現量特徵將基因分群 feat. K-means clustering (下)

RNA-Sick@Day21 > 是擅長畫 Pathway 的朋友啊｜用程式來查京都基因與基因體百科全書 feat. KEGG REST API

RNA-Sick@Day22 > 誰能阻止少年專題生呢？他們聽不到｜用程式上 NCBI 資料庫 feat. NCBI Entrez

RNA-Sick@Day23 > 基因調控什麼的最喜歡了｜啟動子區段序列之順式作用元件分析 feat. PLACE database

RNA-Sick@Day24 > 關於資料視覺化，我想說的是｜用 python 繪製充滿特色的圖表 feat. seaborn

RNA-Sick@Day25 > 我念 HMMER，但是我朋友都念 HMMER，聽說正解是HMMER｜基於隱藏式馬可夫鍊的超強序列比對軟體 feat. HMMER3

RNA-Sick@Day26 > 不被名稱耽誤的套裝軟體｜直接由序列內容預測功能區段 feat. MEME suite

4. Road to an Academic Career

Besides the technical materials regarding data processing or sequence analysis, I included a part to talk about how to make use of digital tools to strengthen academic integrity and build personal brand as early-career researcher.

RNA-Sick@Day27 > 嘴巴說可以，身體卻一點也不老實啊｜程式碼筆記本保證研究可再現性 feat. NextJournal

RNA-Sick@Day28 > 今天的風兒 …有點喧囂啊…｜架個個人網站來輔助你的學術海報呈現 feat. hexo on Github

RNA-Sick@Day29 > 我曾經都用 WORD，直到我膝蓋上中了一箭｜用 GTD 工作術加速論文撰寫 feat. Notion

RNA-Sick@Day30 > 生活就在呼吸之間｜不用寫程式做一個聊天機器人來檢索自己的三十天鐵人文章 (RNA-Sick 生物資訊小指南) feat. Chatfuel

Orientation and Future Perpective

At the end of September 2019, I challenged myself by joining a campaign named “Iron man challenge: Continuous writing 30 days“ hosted by “ITHelp“, one of the biggest information technology communities in Taiwan, and generated the very first version of this quick guide in Chinese. There are many bioinformatics learning resources on the internet with technical details in English. In this quick guide, I intended to bypass the technical details, try to focus on the building of self-teaching habit, value of academic integrity and growth mindset. Once the readers get an overview of what should be expected to learn, they should go on and acquire new knowledge from primary sources such as original research articles published by international academic journals. I plan to keep updating this quick guide as short term objective in terms of not only expanding and deepening the content but also turning it into multimedia tutorials. The long term goal is to make the learning environment and community more supportive and friendly for interdiscilinary learners.

Here are some other awesome online resources and guidelines on the internet

Path to a free self-taught education in Bioinformatics! by OSSU

My Journey Into Data Science and Bioinformatics — Part 1: Programming

Last modified data: Jan 14 2020

Photo by Alina Grubnyak on Unsplash
entry.summary: This guide consists of four parts. I will elaborate on them one by one.

entry.title: Transcriptome Analysis Mini-course
entry.content:
An invitation for horticultural students to bioinformatics

I delivered a lecture about transcriptome analysis in the course Methodology in Horticulture Crop (IV). The following Facebook campaign page contains prerequisites and slides.

https://www.facebook.com/events/2379728395615213/

Prerequisite Learning List

  1. Next generation sequencing
  2. Introduction to molecular biology
  3. Process of transcription
  4. Preparing computer environment
  5. Annotaion systems
  6. Biostatistics

Slides and Handout

Video Slideshow

Handout

Cover image by Louis Reed on Unsplash

entry.title: Conference Summary and Paper Digest
entry.content:
Conference Summary

  1. 作物生產與氣象大數據之聯結論壇, Dec 05 2019
    1. Elements of Resillent Wheat Production Systems Challenges to Intensive Field Crop Production in Germany by Prof. Hartmut Stützel
    2. Current situation of tropical fruit production and research, focusing on the case of mango in Miyazaki prefecture, Japan by Assoc. Prof. Chitose Honsho
    3. 中國歷史文獻氣候數據庫與多元應用 by 林冠慧
    4. Comprehensive discussion by 姚銘輝、劉力瑜、陳柏安、吳君孝、羅筱鳳
  2. Reading and Editing Genome by George Church, Oct 28 2019
  3. The 12th Shang-Fa Yang Memorial Lecture, Oct 28 2019
    1. From Genome to Proteome: A Journey Along The RNA Silk Road by Julia Bailey-Serres
    2. Synthetic-genetic-array Based Yeast One-hybrid System for The Construction of Gene Regulatory Network in Wood Formation by Ying-Chung Jimmy Lin

Paper Digest

  1. Xu, J., Hua, K. & Lang, Z. Genome editing for horticultural crop improvement. Hortic Res 6, 113 (2019) doi:10.1038/s41438-019-0196-5
  2. Mehta, D., Stürchler, A., Anjanappa, R.B. et al. Linking CRISPR-Cas9 interference in cassava to the evolution of editing-resistant geminiviruses. Genome Biol 20, 80 (2019) doi:10.1186/s13059-019-1678-3
  3. D. Duong, A. Uppunda, C. Ju et al. Learning Representations for Gene Ontology Terms by Contextualized Text Encoders. bioRxiv 765644; doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/765644
  4. Cannabis. Nature Outlook. 28 August 2019.

Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash
entry.summary: Conference Summary

entry.title: Supplementary Information and Tools
entry.content:
Supplementary Information

Genome-wide Identification and Analysis of MADS-box Gene Family in Bitter Gourd – Method Details

This part is used to document method details in the poster “Genome-wide Identification and Analysis of MADS-box Gene Family in Bitter Gourd” presented at the “2019 Poster Competition of Department of Horticulture and Landscape Architechture, NTU”.

Genome-wide identification of MADS-box genes

Based on predicted transcripts from the latest genome assembly of bitter gourd (ASM199503v1, Strain: OHB3-1) and our de novo assembled transcriptome data (Cultivar: ‘Moon Shine’), hidden Markov model (HMM) search was conducted using Pfam profiles including SRF-TF (PF00319) and K-box (PF01486). Transcript variants and isoforms were merged and pointed to corresponding gene entity. Each of the gene entity can be assigned to a gene symbol from representative genome of bitter gourd on NCBI database. The first gene product of each gene symbol was used as representative protein for further classification analysis. Naming of MADS-box genes in bitter gourd were based on the corresponding best hit of MADS-box genes in watermelon (Wang et al., 2019).

Phylogenetic analyses of MADS-box genes

Multiple sequence alignments were performed between full-length MADS-box protein sequences from bitter gourd, Arabidopsis, and watermelon using MUSCLE (Edgar, 2004) with default settings in Seqotron (Fourment and Holmes, 2016). An unrooted maximum-likelihood (ML) tree was constructed using the MEGA7. The tree nodes were evaluated by bootstrap analysis for 1000 replicates.

Conserved Motif analysis

MEME-suite (Bailey et al., 1994; Bailey et al., 2009) was applied to predict the conserved motifs of the MADS-box with the following parameter settings: number of repetitions -anr (any number of repetitions), maximum number of motifs -7, minimum motif width -6 and maximum motif width -69.

Treatments and growth conditions of plant materials

Monoecious cultivar ‘Moon Shine’ (MS) and gynoecious cultivar ‘BM3250’ (BM) were chosen. The ratio of staminate/pistillate flowers of MS is 36.54. All of the plants were raised in growth chamber. Day and night temperature were set as 28 ̊C and 25 ̊C, respectively. Day and night durations were set as 16 hours and 8 hours, respectively. Four sex-determination alteration treatments were appied on MS. Gibberelin treatment (GA) and NAA treatment (NAA) refers to the foliar feeding of 100mg/L GA3 and 25mg/L NAA after raising the seedlings to 6~8-leaf stage and 2-leaf stage, repectively. Foliar feeding were conducted for three times, three days apart for each application. Low- temperature seed-soaking treatment (COLD) and gibberelin and low-temperature combined treatment (GC) refers to the seed soaking under 4 ̊C for 15 days in sdH2O and 100mg/L GA3, respectively. A total of six group of seedlings, two control groups of the two cultivars and four treatment groups of MS, were raised to the same stage of 6~8-leaf stage, and then collected for storage in -80 ̊C for further analysis.

Expression analysis of MADS-box genes

In order to construct a comprehensive gene expression matrix of MADS-box genes in bitter gourd, expression profiles of different organs, cultivars, and treatment response of bitter gourd were obtained by RNA-sequencing results from not only NCBI open data but also our own plant materials. SRA-tool was used to retrieve raw fastq data of PRJNA 213805 and PRJNA 319011 from NCBI BioProjects database. PRJNA213805 is a BioProject from India and contains transcriptomes of gynoecious line (Gy323) and monoecious lines (DRAR1) of bitter gourd. PRJNA 319011 is a BioProject contains transcriptomes from different organs of bitter gourd. Total RNA of plant materials mentioned in the “Treatments and growth conditions of plant materials” section were extracted and sequenced with NGS platform. A total of 12 groups of RNA-sequencing data sets were used to construct a comprehensive bitter gourd expression profile. Draft genome sequence (Urasaki et al., 2017) and its predicted transcriptome was used as reference to construct a comprehensive gene expression matrix with transcript quantification software Kallisto (Bray et al., 2016). According to the result of flower sex inducing effect by each treatment in MS, we would call the comparison between Control (CK) and GA as GA3 responsive female-inducing (GA(f)) effect, comparison between COLD and GC as GA3 responsive male-inducing (GA(m)) effect, comparison between CK and COLD as low-temperature responsive female-inducing (LT(f)) effect, and comparison between CK and NAA as NAA responsive female-inducing (NAA(f)) effect. Normalized value of TPM and fold change by z score method were used to visualize and cluster the overall expression matrix of MADS-box genes in bitter gourd.

Cis-acting element analysis of promoter region

New PLACE database (https://www.dna.affrc.go.jp/PLACE/?action=newplace) was used to predict cis-acting elements in the McMADSs’ promoter (1.5 kb upstream from the predicted transcription start site, TSS). In this study, cis-acting elements related to seven biological related categories of interest were selected. The seven categories are hormone responsive elements, tissue specific elements, circadian responsive elements, cell cycle regulation, stress responsive element, TF regulation, light responsive elements. Category related cis-acting elements were picked up according to the presence of keywords in corresponding publication titles. Visualization of each cis-acting elements was conducted with custom python scripts using seaborn rugplot function.

References:

Bailey, T.L., M. Bodén, F.A. Buske, M. Frith, C.E. Grant, L. Clementi, J.Y. Ren, W.W. Li, S.N. William. 2009. MEME SUITE: tools for motif discovery and searching. Nucleic Acids Research. 37:W202-W208.

Bailey, T.L., and C. Elkan. 1994. Fitting a mixture model by expectation maximization to discover motifs in biopolymers. Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Intelligent Systems for Molecular Biology. 28-36.

Bray, N.L., H. Pimentel, P. Melsted, and L. Pachter. 2016. Near-optimal probabilistic RNA-seq quantification. Nature Biotechnology 34:525–527

Edgar R.C. 2004. MUSCLE: multiple sequence alignment with high accuracy and high throughput. Nucleic Acids Research. 32(5) 1792-1797.

Fourment, M., and E.C. Holmes. 2016. Seqotron: a user-friendly sequence editor for Mac OS X. BMC Research Notes. 9(106)

Higo, K., Ugawa, Y., Iwamoto, M. and Korenaga, T. 1999. Plant cis-acting regulatory DNA elements (PLACE) database. Nucleic Acids Research. 2(1):297-300.

Urasaki, N., H. Takagi, S. Natsume, A. Uemura, N. Taniai, N. Miyagi, M. Fukushima, S. Suzuki, K. Tarora, M. Tamaki, M. Sakamoto, R. Terauchi, and H. Matsumura. 2017. Draft genome sequence of bitter gourd (Momordica charantia), a vegetable and medicinal plant in tropical and subtropical regions. DNA Research 24:51-58.

Wang, P., S. Wang, Y. Chen, X. Xu, X. Guang, Y. Zhang. 2019. Genome-wide Analysis of the MADS-Box Gene Family in Watermelon. Computational Biology and Chemistry. 80:341-350.

A Curated List of Tools

1. HRM analysis with PCA and clustering

Principal Component Analysis (PCA) of High Resolution Melting (HRM) Analysis for high throughput genotyping

Demostration on NextJournal

https://nextjournal.com/RNA-Sick/hrm-analysis-with-pca-and-clustering

Citation

Chou, L., S.J. Huang, C. Hsieh, M.T. Lu, C.W. Song, F.C. Hsu. A High Resolution Melting Analysis (HRM)-based Genotyping Toolkit for Chilling Requirement in Peach (Prunus persica). Submitted to International Journal of Molecular Sciences on 11/29/2019.

2. Paper Digest

Paper Digest is a solution for researchers to quickly grasp the core ideas of a paper

Paper Digest Official Site: https://www.paper-digest.com/

Introduciton of Paper Digest by RNA-Sick: https://www.facebook.com/rna.sick/posts/2485881328333576

3. Sourcetrail

Sourcetrail provides both overview and details by combining an interactive dependency graph, a concise code view and efficient code search, all built into an easy-to-use cross-platform developer tool.

Sourcetrail Official Site: https://www.sourcetrail.com/

Introduciton of Sourcetrail by RNA-Sick: https://www.facebook.com/rna.sick/posts/2481779772077065

Photo by CHU TAI on Unsplash
